comments.commentBody:
I am utterly horrified to see our government being utterly hopeless. Yes, I was stupid and one of those who voted them in.
Now I'm paying for it.
Our last hope is people like Prof Tatsuhiko Kodama and others who really know what they are doing.
Please see his angry speech at the Diet committee meeting, which, for some reason, hasn't been broadcasted except one TV station in Japan;
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dlf4gOvzxYc
Voters are mad as heck.  That's what.

By allowing a loss today, smart Obama is really focused on winning 2012 at all cost. He can then truthfully say that the elections is about raising taxes for the rich or raising medicare cost for the poor and elderly.

Sorry, Republican leadership created this mess. Iraq, Medicare Part D giveaway to drug companies, tax cuts we can't afford, a higher (by far) per-citizen defense budget than we had in Vietnam or the Reagan cold-war eras. Never mind the unwillingness to consider regulation of derivatives markets. The market knows best? The market knows how to be a sine wave. Tax cuts create jobs? Where are all the Bush-tax-cut jobs?

Every GOP president in my lifetime has raised the national debt by over 15% of GDP. Conversely, every Democratic president in my lifetime has paid down the debt. How is the current situation President Obama's fault? A stimulus package that created jobs caused these crises? Is that what comes out of the "Illinois Policy Institute"?

That tea-party debt-cutters align with Republicans shows how out of touch they really are. Look it up on Wikipedia - Clinton Balanced the Budget! "We need a balanced budget amendment because Washington just can't help itself." No - Republicans can't help themselves.

The GOP is the party of tax and spend with interest. I get to pay that interest on tax cuts my parents enjoyed. I can only hope to get some of the Medicare and Social Security I am currently paying for.

You can't pin this disaster on President Obama - that is setting the house on fire and then complaining about the fireman's water bill.
The best thing about this for the Tea Party is that when cuts to government spending weaken the economy even further they will get away with blaming the president for it.

It all sounds so good, Mr. Ohara. It also sounded so good in 1937 when the decision to cut back on government stimulus ushered in the last leg of the Great Depression. Of course, when the economy continues to tank over the next two years, I'm confident that you will be the first to blame the President and all Democrats for that situation.

Deflated Presidency! "How to strike out opportunities with no direct hits"

The Tea Party won the battle of troops moral on a highly immoral stand off.

It is time to call it as it is "Obama Presidency, unless proven other wise, is a lame duck presidency".

Political manoeuvrings is not a political ends by itself. You will see Obama rating number plunge into bush era abyss. By moving to the center of the right (and not to the center ie: Health Care Romney & Cuts) this president as gone from hope to the lesser of two evil.

Political movement are marked by momentum that gives a nation the ability to move forward. Obama lost that momentum and will suffer the consequence of it even if reelected. He lost the morality stand to request from me or other militant to rally behind him. I will no more rally behind a presidency that seems no different in its way of governing then a McCain. We voted and rally for change, all we get is little of the same old same old.

Obama will get my vote, yes, but not my support. And that is a huge difference!

Based on this the Tea Party won this political high ground. They will vote, yes, for a Republican President, and this with huge support.

I will leave you with this: My Father always told me that "By trying to please everyone you end up pleasing no one".

PS: Governing to comprise is easier that governing for what you stand for, anyone that tell you other wise is professional politician.

Start sending young players of high school age who are willing to commit to the sport to South American clubs, rather than the continual ridiculous focus on Europe.  The 20 hours a week creative "street" training he is talking about will be developed here in time but for the sake of the USMNT, start clubbing down south.  Further south than Mexico thank you.  Easier to get to timezone-wise to see club players who are potentials for the US roster in Chile or Argentina, or Venezuela or Brazil.  They'll get more playing time in a better and more creative atmosphere for young players headed for the US bigs.  Everybody can't make it to La Masia.  We have South America at our disposal.  Make the elemental and fundamental creativity shift "west from Europe and and south from the US" NOW Jurgi!

Public union pay and benefits in line with private sector compensation.

Federal grant money that gets diverted, misappropriated,and used for in house administration instead of intended purposes eliminated.

One can only hope!

Some of us....came to these shores fifty or so years ago looking for what we called and recognized as "FREEDOM"

No more "FREEDOM" even in the USA!

I am proud of the President and the Dems in Congress.  It is greatly tempting to say now when you are being taunted and blackmailed by people with terrible ideas.  However, when the choice is saying no and taking the economy off the cliff or agreeing to things you don't like and fighting the next day then you save the economy.  It is unfair and foolish to blame the Dems for the irresponsible actions of Conservative Republicans.  They just demonstrated that they are more than willing to drag the country into a depression rather than give up tax breaks for their wealthy patrons.  They have just shown us that the wealthy matter more to them than the programs that most Americans rely upon.  Why aren't we talking about that?   Why are the Dems being slammed when the spotlight should be on the Conservative Republicans who nearly destroyed us?

Elections have consequences unless of course a rouge democrat wins the white house, then less than 10% of the population can hold up the rest of us for 4, 6 8 years at a clip.

I will focus my political energy on trying to convince a liberal/progressive democrat to primary this rouge President out of office, if he's on the ballot for the general election I will stay home.

May 4/8 years of President Bachman is just what this country needs to prove once and for all who has the vast majority of the public's best interest at heart.

This is a disaster for the nation and a further catastrophe for the Democratic Party. Of course Obama had no choice but to cut this deal, given that he had allowed the Republicans and the Tea Party to define the terms of the political debate and shape the crisis. If you show up three hours into the party, your ability to shape the conversation is limited.

The political discussion is firmly set on a tangent: the deficit and debt. As a result, the primary issue- unemployment and the economy- will be adversely affected by draconian spending cuts.

Who would have thought that we would go four years through a Democratic Administration without so much as a chip at the Bush tax cuts or the other corporate welfare items strangling the economy? How humiliating for 80+ focused radical right wing House freshmen to rout the Democratic Senate and President. If there were a Progressive or Liberal Party, I'd be in it, as I have neither confidence nor pride in the Democratic Party as on this evening.

I'm from Melbourne Australia and it beats me how our great friend and ally has managed to find itself in such a financial mess. It's scary and we wish you an early exit from something that sounds like an episode of the 3 stooges.

I'm relieved that we averted the immediate crisis, but the war has just begun.

I have not seen the details of the bill. But I know one absolute fact - this was not a win-win. For if it was, there would have not have been a need for a vote since everyone would want it.

So the first question is: Who gains, who loses? Not politically (yet), but economically.

Obviously, the ones who did not have their taxes raised won.

The ones who will lose jobs lost. (Let's not forget state governments.)

What will increase - investor profits or foreclosures? Losers? Winners?

If this bill gets enacted, and if I see that the wrong people won, I will be willing to join a chorus that supports the formation of a new party coalition to oust the present group that governs. This includes The President, whom I supported way back and all the way up to now.

There were choices at this moment, there was not just one way to go. Thus, those who choose this path must be held accountable. I'm not as powerful (yet) as Grover Norquist, but I will do my best.

From what hasjust transpired, I have to conclude that President Obama is really the Manchurian Candidate with a Republican agenda.

And, I will not be casting a vote in the next presidential election.

THere has to be a radical shift in thinking of all Americans if we aren't to become Greece in 10 years. We ALL have to learn to live more frugally, pull more of our own weight, get better educated as youth and if you blew it then, go back to get your GED, Degree or whatever and GET A JOB. There are far too many people who use any excuse to never work, declare themselves disabled over relatively little, retire way too soon when they are perfectly able-bodied and capable of adding more to the GDP, go to the doctor or emergency room for nothing,lie and cheat on their taxes to get more from the Man. We are the Man, we are all the man and until we recognize that the good of all of us is connected, and pitch in and pull together, we are going down together into the deepest depression we will ever know.
This was but a drop in the bucket and didn't cut deep enough. Too many sacred cows - subsidies, tax increases on those that can easily afford it, defense and endless wars are untouchable. Entitlements should have strings. A WPA, CCC or something like it. Think what we could do and what we could be if we all tightened our belts, pulled up our pants and GOT TO WORK!

The Tea Party/GOP are in full process of bringing our country a return to the days of yesteryear --the late 1800's. This is the beginning of a terrifying slide of the middle class into defeat.  Who would have thought that Barack Obama would turn out to be so weak?  This is a heart-breaking moment.
Mr.Obama. You still have a chance. Next time be a strong leader with determination and stand up for us! We can learn from our mistakes. Make it possible for us to have hope!

None of these commentors seem to realize the simple fact that:

THERE ARE NO BUDGET CUTS BEING PROPOSED BY EITHER SIDE.

The cuts are fictitious, the numbers they start with are from the congressional budget office's proposed future budgets, which already contain increases from prior years. Even the Republican proposal actually increases the budget by $1 trillion.

Using fudged numbers makes for a big media circus and makes all the sheeples either outraged or happy because it sounds like there are budget cuts happening, so they all go on their various blogs and either gloat or celebrate or complain or sit at home worrying.

The use of a ten year period is part of the fraud, it makes the numbers bigger. The only budget that makes any difference is this year's budget, because next year they throw it all out and start the fraud all over again.

Obama going on tv threatening little old ladies with their soc sec checks and threatening dee-fault is simply a shameful lie. We have a $200 BN monthly income which would allow us to pay interest on the debt, soc sec, military wages and pensions, then have $80 BN left for whatever gov't we wanted until congress got it's act together.

It's all a big hyped up media frenzy and a huge lie, so curb your enthusiasm, folks!

Here is a video of someone I know you'll agree is trustworthy, who knows economics backward and forward & right to left, talking to a former budget official. It's Kudlow vs. Ron Paul. Kudlow grunts when Paul reveals the fiction, because as a former budget official he' part of the media cover-up. Then he agrees several times, each time more emphatically to try to shut Paul up, then it's good-bye Mr. Paul we're out of time....and next up? The Boehner Bill!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kJ7dwmv8rVE

President Obama may think of himself as a frustrated parent trying to bring his two screaming and hair-pulling children to some kind of reasonable compromise. But to this observer it seems much more likely that he plays the role of a pleading and powerless child trying to bridge the gap and make peace between his two estranged and feuding parents who will not make peace under any circumstance. He can plead and in his mind be may have the power to determine the outcome, but in reality the child is powerless to influence the parents in this situation and acts out the scenario instead to provoke the parents pity and diffuse its own lack of power.

I feel for him, if that is the case.

But the country suffers by him as he is reenacting these childhood nightmares of his.

He was to immature for the job. He was too young for the job. He loved his life and family too much for the job. That says a lot of bad things about the job, I suppose - but THAT'S the job. If you are afraid to become a target don't become a President.

"I can conceive of a society in which all men would feel an equal love and respect for the laws of which they consider themselves as the authors; in which the authority of the government would be respected as necessary, though not as divine; and in which the loyalty of the subject to the chief magistrate would not be a passion, but a quiet and rational persuasion. Every individual being in the possession of rights which is he sure to retain, a kind of manly courtesy would arise between all classes, alike removed from pride and servility. The people, well acquainted with their own true interests, would understand that, in order to profit by the advantages of society, it is necessary to satisfy its requisitions. The voluntary association of citizens might then take the place of the individual exertions of the nobles, and the community would be a like protected from anarchy and from oppression."

-Alexis de Tocqueville, "Democracy in America."

Would that we lived up to this wise man's vision.
I wish Obama had been forced to resign as part of this deal. I voted for him but clearly he has failed us all.

This agreement amounts to paying a ransom for the US Constitution.

And imagine this, there were individuals in Congress who thought that the United States of America should decide not to pay some of its public debt. The citizens of this country were so outraged that in 1868 we passed the 14th amendment to the US Constitution that obligates Congress not to question the validity of the public debt of the United States.

Imagine this, Congress would pass legislation without any budget or concern over how to pay for it and then say, you know that legislation that we created, we aren’t going to pay what it costs, somebody else will have to. Absurd? Welcome to the Republican party.

Imagine this, Congress would be required to specify exactly and authorize how every piece of legislation be financed. That is exactly how it worked until The Second Liberty Bond Act (1917) (the “debt limit” legislation) gave Congress the authority to create un-funded legislation. Absurd? The Republican party is saying that it is not our responsibility to pay. Take the cost out of something that the Republicans do not support.

I believe that our founding fathers would call the Republican party’s behavior treason and the tea party’s actions insurrection. And they would be right! What are the current penalties for these crimes?

The House speaker will not allow anything to come to a vote that may pass with a minority Republican vote. That is obstruction of congress, a felony!

The deficit and economic collapse was created by the Republicans and they insist that the victims of their actions pay the debt not the beneficiaries. That should be criminal!

And these criminals are practicing terrorism against the United States of America. What is the penalty for treason, insurrection, terrorism and violation of the 14th amendment?

Thank you for posting the complete vote.
Our representative, Congressman Ted Poe, (D-TX), a former state district judge voted to bring down our government, our economy and our country.
Contemptable and inexcusable.
He's gonna hear from me.
Had I been serving in Congress, I would have gotten up to speak on the floor of the House with a clothespin on my nose, but I would have voted for this awful legislation simply because there was no more time for debate.
The country's economy is on the ropes and probably will stay there for some time.
It would have been a hard vote for me, but in the end, the state of the nation and my oath to the Constitution would leave me no choice.
What a pity that our representative has so corrupted his reasoning that he couldn't figure this out.
